        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>
            <source>LRE.learningResourceTypeValues</source>
            <value>lesson plan</value>
          </learningResourceType>
          <intendedEndUserRole>
            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>
            <value>teacher</value>
          </intendedEndUserRole>
          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">13-15</string>
            <string language="en">13-15</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">1.	From the history of the mathematics ( usage of Calibrate resources’ slides) – a few words about Pythagoras, his life and creation is presented to students.
2.	Description of right triangle and  its legs ( usage of Calibrate resources’ illustrations).
3.	Pythagorean Theorem’s formulation(Calibrate resources):
a)	 presentation of its geometrical interpretation
b)	illustration of Theorem’s proof
4.	Students are given – as an interesting fact – characteristics of some numbers ( so-called ‘Pythagorean’s threes’: 3,4,5 or 5,12,13).
5.	Usage of Pythagorean Theorem-Special Triangles ( Maths for Morons).
6.	Wide scope of Pythagoream Theorem’s usage in geometry is shown to students, they do some practice: make calculations of missing right triangle’s leg; diagonals of square, rectangle, trapezium and rombhus; height of given figures (usage of Calibrate resources – Pitagorov izrek) – in order to find the figures’ area and peripheries.
</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
